item.title: 'Will not lead to humanity's demise': Bill Gates calls for change of approach to climate crisis
item.description: <p>One of the world&#x27;s richest men has called for governments, investors, activists and scientists to change their approach to the climate crisis ahead of next month&#x27;s COP30 summit in Brazil.</p>

item.title: Brisbane records wettest day since Cyclone Alfred as troughs drench east coast
item.description: <p>Two distinct trough lines hit the state with bands of heavy rain bet﻿ween midday and midnight, lashing the city with its heaviest October downpour in five years. </p>

item.title: Brisbane man jailed for six years after planning to help overthrow Syrian government
item.description: <p>T﻿he 35-year-old man is set to serve a minimum non-parole period of four years and six months.</p>

item.title: The world's most valuable public company just laid out its vision for the future
item.description: <p>N﻿vidia recently became the first public firm to reach a $US4 trillion ($6 trillion) valuation.</p>

item.title: Trump confident of clinching trade deal from high-stakes meeting with China's leader
item.description: <p>W﻿orld markets will be watching closely when the pair sit down on the sidelines of the APEC summit in South Korea.</p>

item.title: Rate cut hopes all but dashed after inflation data comes in hot
item.description: <p>Australians hoping for an interest rate cut next week will likely have to wait a while longer after crucial data came in far hotter than expected.</p>

item.title: Lawyer for accused Easey Street double murderer raises 'alternate suspect'
item.description: <p>Detectives questioned an alternate suspect over the Easey Street double murder almost 50 years ago and &quot;had no doubt&quot; he had killed the two women, a defence lawyer claims.</p>

item.title: Bilpin has a problem, and nobody seems to know why
item.description: <p>Owners of an apple orchard in Greater Sydney estimate that they have only grown five to ten per cent of the amount of apples that they normally harvest during this season. </p>

item.title: Rapist ex-MP's sentence delayed by 11th-hour legal bid
item.description: <p>T﻿he Former Kiama state MP was found guilty of rape and three indecent assaults in July following a jury trial.</p>

item.title: Alleged murderer claims 'true love' for ex casts doubt on accusations
item.description: <p>Danny Zayat is standing trial in the NSW Supreme Court after pleading not guilty to the murder of Tatiana Dokhotaru.</p>

item.title: AFP to capture 'national security threat' behind synagogue firebombing as number one priority
item.description: <p>The ﻿Australian Federal Police has made the capture of a man suspected of conspiring with foreign spies to help orchestrate the firebombing of a Melbourne synagogue as their number one priority.</p>

item.title: Bureau of Meteorology make vow over website after public backlash
item.description: <p><strong>The government weather agency has confirmed it will make changes to its website after a multi-million dollar overhaul was widely</strong><a href="https://www.9news.com.au/national/bureau-of-meteorology-new-website-relaunch-criticised-david-crisafulli-wild-weather-national-news/3e221cb4-0d49-429e-9c78-0c3577a351d8" title=" criticised." target="" rel=""><strong>criticised.</strong></a><strong></strong></p>

item.title: 'Extremely traumatic': Minister vows investigation after hundreds of Queensland students taught wrong syllabus
item.description: <p>Nine high schools across the state found out they had taught year 12 ancient history students about Roman emperor Augustus Caesar instead of Julius Caesar.</p>

item.title: 100 GPs to be given power to diagnose ADHD in South Australia
item.description: <p>From February, selected general practitioners in South Australia will be able to diagnose and treat ADHD in adults and children over eight years of age. </p>

item.title: Teenage cricketer fighting for life in hospital after being injured at training
item.description: <p>It is believed the player, a 17-year-old boy, had been batting in the nets when he was hit in the head and neck area by a ball, bowled from an automatic machine.</p>

item.title: Singapore Airlines flight diverted back to Melbourne Airport
item.description: <p>T﻿he Singapore Airlines flight experienced a technical issue shortly after takeoff.</p>

item.title: Dozens charged during 'unprecedented' AN0M app police sting
item.description: <p>Police swarmed on multiple properties during 23 early-morning raids across Adelaide and regional locations in SA today, arresting dozens of people with alleged links to bikie gangs.</p>

item.title: Everything you need to know about the Oasis Live '25 ﻿tour
item.description: <p>Legendary Britpop rockers Oasis have touched down in Australia, with the Gallagher brothers arriving in Melbourne separately.</p>

item.title: Accused Nazi saluter professes love for Australia
item.description: <p>He was allegedly in the company of far-right National Socialist Network members at a Perth CBD licensed venue when he made four Nazi salute gestures in view of the public.</p>

item.title: Mum claims she used recalled sunscreen for two years before skin cancer diagnosis
item.description: <p>&quot;I was really shocked that it happened to me because I couldn&#x27;t imagine doing much more to prevent it.&quot;</p>

item.title: Hurricane Melissa downgraded after lashing Cuba
item.description: H﻿urricane Melissa has made landfall in Jamaica as a Category 5 storm, with "catastrophic" damage expected.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves 25 dead in Haiti, causes widespread damage in Jamaica and Cuba
item.description: <p>Dozens of homes collapsed and people were still trapped under rubble in a country that wasn&#x27;t even on Hurricane Melissa&#x27;s path.</p>

item.title: Deadliest day in Gaza since ceasefire as Israel launches wave of strikes, accusing Hamas of breaching truce
item.description: <p>Israel accused Hamas of killing a soldier and staging the discovery of a deceased hostage.</p>

item.title: Paris prosecutor says two suspects in Louvre jewel heist 'partially' admit participation
item.description: <p>French police acknowledged major gaps in the Louvre&#x27;s defences — turning the dazzling daylight theft into a national reckoning over how France protects its treasures.</p>
